comments: I went to his office hours twice. The second time I went. I was basically yelled at. I tried to solve the problem a different way which he wasn\'t able to understand. He then proceeded to raise his voice at me, "Do you know what x is?!". Afterward, I didn\'t want to attend class any longer and went to the other professor with my questions.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (2)  Get ready to read (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
stu_tags: TOUGH GRADER  GET READY TO READ
comments: Prof. Lee has a very thick accent which makes lectures a chore to be involved in. Although he can be extremely nice and helpful, his lectures are the book copied onto powerpoint. I do not doubt his knowledge of the material, but question whether he should be teaching a general physics course.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (2)  Get ready to read (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: Really nice guy, and an extremely knowledgeable physicist. take him, his exams are predicable (from book and homework problems), and his final was extremely easy i would say. Ended up with A+ because of the extra credits.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (2)  Get ready to read (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: He really hopes that his students do well in the class, that\'s why he is always available to help. You have to listen to him very carefully in order to follow what he\'s saying. That keeps you awake in class! Exams are not easy though.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (2)  Get ready to read (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: He really seems to care about his students, but can be very difficult to follow in lecture. His exam was very straightforward but the final was terrible. This was written with another prof though so that may explain the discrepancy in difficulty level.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (2)  Get ready to read (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: Yes he has a strong Chinese accent but he extremely cares about his students. Classes are easy to follow if you read the textbook prior to attending his class. A very good motivator and is always available to help his students. Extremely patient and wants all of his students to score well. His exams are reasonable (not difficult). Good prof!!!

tag_professor: Tough Grader (2)  Get ready to read (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: He gave us a pretest that contained things no one in our class knew how to do and gave us 10 days to do it and it counted for 10% of our grade.\r \r He also got pissed that we didn\'t go over basic thermo in p221.\r \r He speaks in a really heavy accent that is really hard to understand and his handwriting sucks too.
